Why is Godot not finding a node?

Ask Question
Asked yesterday
Modified yesterday
Viewed 19 times
0

I am trying to make a health bar above an enemy in the game I am working on. I want to access the TextureProgressBar node to change the value to the enemy's health. My node tree looks like this:

I am trying to access TextureProgressBar from Path2D with the path "Control/TextureProgressBar" I get the error: @ _process(): Node not found: "Control/TextureProgressBar" (relative to "/root/world/Enemy/Path2D"). I have tried defining the node as a variable in @onready but that also did not work. I have also tried having the Control node be a child of Enemy and used the path "../Control/TextureProgressBar". The relevant code looks like this:

var health_bar = get_node("Control/TextureProgressBar")
health_bar.value = health```
  • nodes
  • godot
  • godot4
Share
Improve this question
asked yesterday
Mildly IntelligentMildly Intelligent
8388 bronze badges
1
  • This is working fine for me in a new Godot 4.3 project. Is there more to your node tree?
    – TrampolineTales
    Commented 21 hours ago
Add a comment  |
